strings.Value: "Of course, Harrim. If I find any dwarven ruins, I'll take you to them."
"Don't, Harrim. It will bring you nothing but pain."
{n}Harrim looks embarrassed. He runs his fingers through his beard and clears his throat a few times, then speaks at last.{/n} "I heard... Not that it is important, but... Well..."

{n}He clears his throat again.{/n} "I heard that an ancient trade road built by the dwarves of {g|Five Kings Mountains}the Five Kings Mountains{/g} runs through these lands. I don't know what happened to them, or where they went. Unforgiving time spares no one... But the road itself is still here. And possibly not only the road."
{n}Harrim holds his beard in his fist.{/n} "Well... {Name}, I have a request. If you find any dwarven ruins in the area, I'd like to see them with my own eyes."

{n}Harrim fiddles with his beard again.{/n} "I shouldn't, probably. But it's like a wound that's never healed. You know it will only hurt more, but you still need to scratch it... Of course it's foolish, foolish and vain... But still I wish to look at them."
"Thank you, {Name}. I, well... Ahem! Thank you."
"You are right, {Name}, I know you're right... And yet I want to go there."
